description.narrative: Appraisal of the Global Commission on Adaptation

policy-marker.narrative: Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

title.narrative: Action Tracks: At least 8 high-impact Action Tracks on the main subthemes will have been conceived, launched and taken into implementation by the main proponents in these areas.

target.value: All Action Tracks have fully developed targets, plans and supporting commitments and are ready to begin implementation.

actual.value: Delayed due to Covid-19 pandemic. Target expected to be reached mid-2021

title.narrative: Communication and Outreach: A concerted campaign to ensure that adaptation is globally recognized as a political priority. The reputation and political clout of Conveners and Commissioners will have been put to optimal use for this purpose.

-- High quality website featuring a ’Solutions Blog’ for Commission members and partners, and other externally-sourced content - "How to communicate about adaptation" toolkit, based upon an extensive research programme for practitioners. - Incorporation of adaptation issues within climate change campaigns.

target.value: Climate change adaptation is recognised by target policymakers and politicians, including in Ministries of Finance, Planning and equivalent departments, as an important issue to address.

actual.value: Climate change adaptation is recognised by target audience.

target.value: Climate change adaptation priorities in Action Tracks are recognised by targeted policymakers and politicians, including in Ministries of Finance, Planning and equivalent departments, and other relevant stakeholders.

actual.value: Early recognition in target audience of climate change adaptation priorities in Action Tracks. The planned summit has been postponed to early 2021 due to Covid-19 pandemic and will contribute to target being fully met.

title.narrative: States, cities, companies, communities – supported by the GCA and its partners – intensify their efforts to become climate resilient and are better equipped to do so.

target.value: The Global Commission on Adaptation is expanded in both number of commissioners and number of ‘convening countries’ and has concrete action plans for adaptation, written down in the ‘Action Tracks’ that are ready for implementation in 2021.
